job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* In close collaboration with our CTO and different technical and artistic teams define, develop and run the next version of our rendering technology (both from a creative tooling & pipeline perspective and our end-user software).
     * Guiding and make pipeline technology choices and define the future architecture of our technology platform.
     * Close collaboration with our Grip development and technical teams to identify shared (technical) approaches.
     * Collaborating with our artists to develop the tools and automation they need.
     * Build, test & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline.
     * Document and possibly train artists to use the pipeline, pick up enhancements and implement directly.
job_details.full_text:
Lead Pipeline Engineer/Head of Pipeline

* In close collaboration with our CTO and different technical and artistic teams define, develop and run the next version of our rendering technology (both from a creative tooling & pipeline perspective and our end-user software).
     * Guiding and make pipeline technology choices and define the future architecture of our technology platform.
     * Close collaboration with our Grip development and technical teams to identify shared (technical) approaches.
     * Collaborating with our artists to develop the tools and automation they need.
     * Build, test & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline.
     * Document and possibly train artists to use the pipeline, pick up enhancements and implement directly.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on pipeline engineering for rendering technology, involving creative tooling and artistic collaboration. While it mentions building, testing, and deploying changes, it lacks specific details about AI/ML models, generative techniques, or predictive tasks that would align it with ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer profiles. The emphasis is on traditional software development and infrastructure for creative workflows, making it fall under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's not primarily an AI-focused technical role.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves defining, developing, and running rendering technology, including creative tooling and end-user software. It also mentions building, testing, and deploying frequent changes and updates to the pipeline, which are core software development activities.
job_tasks.phrase: define, develop and run the next version of our rendering technology (both from a creative tooling & pipeline perspective and our end-user software)

job_tasks.justification: Making technology choices and defining the future architecture of the technology platform are key aspects of software architecture and development.
job_tasks.phrase: Guiding and make pipeline technology choices and define the future architecture of our technology platform

job_tasks.justification: Close collaboration with technical and artistic teams, and identifying shared technical approaches, indicates a need to understand different team's needs and align technical strategies.
job_tasks.phrase: In close collaboration with our CTO and different technical and artistic teams

job_tasks.justification: Collaborating with artists to develop tools and automation directly relates to building software solutions for specific user needs.
job_tasks.phrase: Collaborating with our artists to develop the tools and automation they need

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Build, test & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline' directly describes the operational aspects of software development, including deployment and maintenance.
job_tasks.phrase: Build, test & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline

job_tasks.justification: Documenting and training artists on how to use the pipeline and implement enhancements involves understanding user needs and facilitating adoption, which aligns with business understanding and user enablement.
job_tasks.phrase: Document and possibly train artists to use the pipeline, pick up enhancements and implement directly
